com.meteorcode.pathway.logging

Class CacheLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.meteorcode.pathway.logging.CacheLog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LogDestination

    public class CacheLog
extends java.lang.Object
implements LogDestination
    A LogDestination backed by a ConcurrentCache: Logs logged to this destination are rolled into the cache with the intention of being viewed later if there is a reason to need these logs. Created by xyzzy on 8/19/14.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CacheLog()
      Creates a new log backed by a String concurrent cache of the default size; 200 cached lines.
      CacheLog(ConcurrentCache<java.lang.String> cache)
      Creates a new log backed by the given ConcurrentCache.
      CacheLog(int size)
      Creates a new log backed by a String concurrent cache of the given size.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ConcurrentCache<java.lang.String> getCache()
      Get the current cache being used by this CacheLog.
      void log(java.lang.String message)
      Log a String to this destination with default context
      void log(java.lang.String tag, java.lang.String message)
      Log a String to this destination with the given context tag
      void log(java.lang.String tag, java.lang.String message, java.lang.Throwable t)
      Log a message with context and Throwable attached.
      void log(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Throwable t)
      Log a String, with optional Throwable (such as an exception), and default context to this destination.
